description.narrative: Consideration of biodiversity in plans and policies for tourism development by government planning authorities and the private sector

comment.narrative: No explicit reflection of biodiversity priorities
At least 80 of known and available plans and policies for tourism development incorporate biodiversity priorities

20 achieved
At this point biodiversity is not clearly depicted in the tourism policies and plans However MoTA incorporates general environmental protection and ecofriendly practices with focus on lowering water and energy consumption and using renewable energy resources
The achieved 20 is based on the following facts
A green unit has been recently established to serve as a policy tool to mainstream green practices particularly in relation to biodiversity conservation
Furthermore the new investment Law No 30 for the Year 2014 which gave a clear and direct highlight on the role of Jordan Investment Commission JIC in protection of the environmental water resources natural resources and biodiversity in line with the environmental law regulations and instruments and in close coordination with the relevant bodies
Its important to mention that The National Tourism Strategy NTS 20112015 is a private sectorled with public sector partnership The strategic objective of the Pillar 4 Enabling Environment is to Enhance Jordans business operational regulatory environmental and institutional settings to underpin the drive for improved competitiveness which gave a clear and direct highlight on the importance of environment and sustainability by adopting initiatives that protect and preserve the environment
The project is currently assessing existing legal and institutional setups with attempt to identify policy gaps to be addressed later
At least 80 of known and available plans and policies for tourism development incorporate biodiversity priorities

20 achieved

Furthermore the new investment Law No 30 for the Year 2014 which gave a clear and direct highlight on the role of Jordan Investment Commission JIC in protection of the environmental water resources natural resources and biodiversity in line with the environmental law regulations and instruments and in close coordination with the relevant bodies
Its important to mention that The National Tourism Strategy NTS 20112015 is a private sectorled with public sector partnership The strategic objective of the Pillar 4 Enabling Environment is to Enhance Jordans business operational regulatory environmental and institutional settings to underpin the drive for improved competitiveness which gave a clear and direct highlight on the importance of environment and sustainability by adopting initiatives that protect and preserve the environment
The project is currently assessing existing legal and institutional setups with attempt to identify policy gaps to be addressed later

description.narrative: Hectares of landscape where impacts on biodiversity are avoided mitigated or offset

comment.narrative: No planning provisions for the protection of biodiversity outside formal PAs
Some 180000 hectares covered by biodiversityfriendly landuse plans effectively preventing impact on biodiversity

91659 hectares
Total of 17459 hectares in Petra Landscape covered by comprehensive land use plan that considers biodiversity component Of which 11900 hectares covered by PAP Buffer land use plan the plan aimed at ensuring the integrity of the ecological cultural and archeological values within the Petra archeological Park PAP
Tow expansion areas have been covered by land use plans that also ensure the integrity of the ecological cultural and natural values within Petra landscape With a total area of 5559 hectares
The project will pursue its effort to enhance the enforcement of the policies and regulatory frameworks as related to land use planning within Petra land scape
Wadi Rum area a total area of 74200 hectares is covered by zoning plan within Rum PA as part of the master management plan The whole management plan and its zoning plans designed to conserve the ecological and cultural values
The project concluded the consultation phase with ASEZA and other concerned stakeholders to identify and prioritize the land use planning priorities based on which it was decided to address the issue of developing a comprehensive land use plan for the buffer zone of Rum that addresses the ecological values and integrity of the protected area The sought land use plan should insure the sustainability of natural and cultural assets of Rum protected area and maintaining associated ecosystem services The new land use plan will cover another 60000 hectares
Given the complications of land use planning component across the three sites and provided that there are existing ongoing initiatives the project started with extensive scoping assignment in order to understand the current situation and to identify possible incremental support in each site that complements and builds on existing land use practices The scoping study revealed the gaps and priorities in each site it also resulted with priority interventions in each site for instance it was revealed the buffer zone of Rum PA is a top priority as far as the biodiversity conservation is conserved The study included deep analysis of legal set up institutional set up technical and human capacities data management and existing monitoring regimes
Some 180000 hectares covered by biodiversityfriendly landuse plans effectively preventing impact on biodiversity

Given the complications of land use planning component across the three sites and provided that there are existing ongoing initiatives the project started with extensive scoping assignment in order to understand the current situation and to identify possible incremental support in each site that complements and builds on existing land use practices The scoping study revealed the gaps and priorities in each site it also resulted with priority interventions in each site for instance it was revealed the buffer zone of Rum PA is a top priority as far as the biodiversity conservation is conserved The study included deep analysis of legal set up institutional set up technical and human capacities data management and existing monitoring regimes

description.narrative: Level of consideration for biodiversity conservation in tourism development proposals

comment.narrative: While energy and water feature in environmental considerations at present biodiversity does not
100 of proposals for tourism development consider biodiversity conservation seriously

To date 5 of the new proposals for tourism development considers biodiversity explicitly In preparation to achieving this target the project has been working hardly on establishing green unit under the umbrella of MoTA the unit has been approved by the minister and private sector board to be added to the existing structure As per the preliminary design of the unit it will be attached to licensing and classification department to ensure proper integration of biodiversity considerations in all new tourism proposals As soon as it comes to function the percentage will considerably increase
100 of proposals for tourism development consider biodiversity conservation seriously

To date 5 of the new proposals for tourism development considers biodiversity explicitly In preparation to achieving this target the project has been working hardly on establishing green unit under the umbrella of MoTA the unit has been approved by the minister and private sector board to be added to the existing structure As per the preliminary design of the unit it will be attached to licensing and classification department to ensure proper integration of biodiversity considerations in all new tourism proposals As soon as it comes to function the percentage will considerably increase

description.narrative: Improved management effectiveness particularly in revenue generation tourism planning and management and community relations in Dibeen Shoubak and Wadi Rum Protected Areas
METT scores in each of Dibbin Wadi Rum and PAP PAs

comment.narrative:
Scores obtained during PPG are
Dibeen 58
Wadi Rum 67
PAP to be determined
Improvements expected in effectiveness in revenue generation tourism planning and management and community relations leading to an improvement in METT scores of around 810

This indicator will be measured at the Midterm Evaluation phase
However this score enhanced through project intervention within the three sites the establishment of the GISWebbased data base information management system The system will facilitate reporting and monitoring on the status of biodiversity in all project sites including the three species
Furthermore the project conducted significant efforts to provide adequate training program to fulfill management objectives to the project site teams two main training programs were conducted during reporting period the first training program dealt with management plans development and implementation and involved 20 participants from RSCN PDTRA and ASEZARum PA
The second training program was focused on Protected Area Regulations and Legislation Enforcement it was aimed at instructing course participants about law and regulations that govern management and operation of protected areas including law enforcement and involved six participants from ASEZARum PDTRA and RSCNDibbin
Improvements expected in effectiveness in revenue generation tourism planning and management and community relations leading to an improvement in METT scores of around 810

The second training program was focused on Protected Area Regulations and Legislation Enforcement it was aimed at instructing course participants about law and regulations that govern management and operation of protected areas including law enforcement and involved six participants from ASEZARum PDTRA and RSCNDibbin

description.narrative: Financial security and sustainability of PAs

comment.narrative: The three PAs less so with Wadi Rum currently rely almost entirely on government grants andor development aid as sources of finance
Increase the level of financial resources that are generated on site and not reliant on government budget or development aid to 50

No substantial progress
However for the case of Rum the new management plan emphasized on enhancing financial sustainability It was recommended to develop a standalone business plan with aim to diversify and increase sources of income
Business planning for Rum PA is planned to take place in the second half 2015
The three PAs still rely almost entirely on government grants little changes have occurred in the reporting period
The political unrest in the region represents causes a dramatic decline in tourism sector Most of the tourism sites in Jordan including PAs experience serious reduction in visitors number with less financial resources collected
Increase the level of financial resources that are generated on site and not reliant on government budget or development aid to 50

No substantial progress
However for the case of Rum the new management plan emphasized on enhancing financial sustainability It was recommended to develop a standalone business plan with aim to diversify and increase sources of income
Business planning for Rum PA is planned to take place in the second half 2015
The three PAs still rely almost entirely on government grants little changes have occurred in the reporting period
The political unrest in the region represents causes a dramatic decline in tourism sector Most of the tourism sites in Jordan including PAs experience serious reduction in visitors number with less financial resources collected

description.narrative: Institutional capacities for planning monitoring and enforcement strengthened in Jerash Petra and Wadi Rum landscapesdevelopment zones so as to manage the impacts of tourism development on biodiversity within ecologically valuable and sensitive areas
Increase in land area where threats to ecologically sensitive areas from tourism activities are controlled

comment.narrative: 0 ha

Jerash Governorate Aleppo Pine Pinus halepensis Forests 6200 ha
Petra Region Hisheh Forest Quercus coccifera 300 ha
Wadi Rum Landscape Sand Dune vegetation Haloxylon persicum type 8900 ha

830 hectares in Aleppo pine forest
In case of Aleppo pine forest in an attempt to reduce adverse impact from tourism activities on the forest the project supported the design of a new alternative picnicking site the new site once constructed will be used for heavy tourism activities by this the Aleppo pine forest will be given the opportunity to rehabilitate and relax with much less tourism pressure The project managed to leverage extra financial resources from the Royal Court to fund the construction phase of the alternative site
The first phase of the land use planning component was a preparatory phase in which a comprehensive analysis for the current situation in all project sites was done based on this review an action plans and major gaps were identified The second phase will be informed by the first phase and will cover 60000 hectares as a buffer zone for Wadi Rum PA which will include the Sand dune vegetation 8900 ha and will positively affect the conservation of this important vegetation type
For Hisheh site based on the first phase showed that PDTRA was intensively working on the land use activities recently the project intervention in the second phase will be focused on the legal and enforcement levels the current land use plans suggest Hisheh area as a green area

For Hisheh site based on the first phase showed that PDTRA was intensively working on the land use activities recently the project intervention in the second phase will be focused on the legal and enforcement levels the current land use plans suggest Hisheh area as a green area

description.narrative:
Populations of the following indicator species across the landscape inside and outside PAs remain stable
Jerash Governorate Lacerta media
Petra Vulpes cana
Wadi Rum Caracal caracal

comment.narrative: Baseline populations
No decrease over baseline values

The project started with extensive fauna and flora surveys in the three sites the surveys aim produce up to date ecovalues zonation maps in association with social values and geological values for the three sites And to assess the current situation of these key species The collected data will be used in the other hand to update the contents of the Biodiversity Information Management System BIMS and to setup the monitoring indicators
The project will develop a monitoring program for the key species in each site including theses important ones
The project has significantly contributed to achieve this target through the establishment of the GISWebbased data base information management system The system will facilitate reporting on the status of biodiversity in all project sites including the three species
No decrease over baseline values

The project started with extensive fauna and flora surveys in the three sites the surveys aim produce up to date ecovalues zonation maps in association with social values and geological values for the three sites And to assess the current situation of these key species The collected data will be used in the other hand to update the contents of the Biodiversity Information Management System BIMS and to setup the monitoring indicators
The project will develop a monitoring program for the key species in each site including theses important ones

comment.narrative: Current land area covered by biodiversitysensitive LUPs is nil
180000 hectares covered by integrated landuse plans

91659 hectares
Petra site Total of 17459
Wadi Rum area a total area of 74200
Given the complications of land use planning component across the three sites and provided that there are existing ongoing initiatives the project started with extensive scoping assignment in order to understand the current situation and to identify possible incremental support in each site that complements and builds on existing land use practices The scoping study revealed the gaps and priorities in each site it also resulted with priority interventions in each site for instance it was revealed the buffer zone of Rum PA is a top priority as far as the biodiversity conservation is conserved The study included deep analysis of legal set up institutional set up technical and human capacities data management and existing monitoring regime
Total of 17459 hectares in Petra Landscape covered by comprehensive land use plan that considers biodiversity component Of which 11900 hectares covered PAP Buffer land use plan the planned aimed at Transforming the concept of development in land use plan from pure physical construction and development to controlled oriented Activities within an overall compromised management planning framework to achieve the different required levels of protection while achieving also the required socioeconomic development
Tow expansion areas have been covered by land use plan that also ensuring the integrity of the ecological cultural and natural values within Petra landscape With a total area of 5559 hectares
The project will pursue its effort to enhance the enforcement of the policies and regulatory frameworks as related to land use planning within Petra land scape

description.narrative: Capacity development indicator score for mainstreaming biodiversity in Jordan

comment.narrative: Overall score 43
Overall score gt 60

A percentage will be given at the Midterm Evaluation phase
However this score is enhanced through project intervention within the three sites for instance the establishment of the GISWebbased data base information management system will facilitate reporting and monitoring on the status of biodiversity in all project sites
Furthermore the project conducted significant efforts to provide adequate training program to fulfill management objectives to the project site teams two main training programs were conducted during reporting period the first training program dealt with management plans development and implementation and involved 20 participants from RSCN PDTRA and ASEZARum PA mainly aimed at
Understand the added value and benefits of biodiversity management in and around cultural World Heritage sites
Know how to access and use additional guidance and resources on biodiversity management in a World Heritage context
The second training program was focused on Protected Area Regulations and Legislation Enforcement it was aimed at instructing course participants about law and regulations that govern management and operation of protected areas including law enforcement and involved six participants from ASEZARum PDTRA and RSCNDibbin
As a results of the conducted training PA teams are equipped now with the knowledge and the skills that enable them to conduct a simple participatory CMP Open Standards based PA management planning process on their own
Moreover two participants are working now with international consultant in order to develop integrated management plan for Petra site

description.narrative: Level of credibility of licensing and permitting authorities who sanction and regulate tourism developments

comment.narrative: Survey to confirm and document credibility level in the eyes of stakeholders primarily the tourism sector
Enhanced credibility of licensing and permitting authorities as a result of an improved basis for decisionmaking arising from sound data and information and effective monitoring system

0
The project is in process of finalizing biodiversity information management system BIMS which is GISweb based system The BIMS is meant to establish sound data and information and effective monitoring system at the regional level it will also serve the land use planning purposes by offering reliable data and information for NHS layers and ultimately for licensing and permitting procedures It important to mention that local and national authorities would have access to BIMS to be used for more reliable decision making
On the other hand the establishment of the green unit within MoTA will sever as a national monitoring and control system for new tourism developments based on which the MoTA will be enabled to make decisions properly
Enhanced credibility of licensing and permitting authorities as a result of an improved basis for decisionmaking arising from sound data and information and effective monitoring system

0
The project is in process of finalizing biodiversity information management system BIMS which is GISweb based system The BIMS is meant to establish sound data and information and effective monitoring system at the regional level it will also serve the land use planning purposes by offering reliable data and information for NHS layers and ultimately for licensing and permitting procedures It important to mention that local and national authorities would have access to BIMS to be used for more reliable decision making
On the other hand the establishment of the green unit within MoTA will sever as a national monitoring and control system for new tourism developments based on which the MoTA will be enabled to make decisions properly

description.narrative: Regulatory and enforcement framework in place to avoid reduce mitigate and offset adverse impacts of tourism on biodiversity
Percentage of tourism establishments in project localities that are biodiversityfriendly according to the MoTA Certification Scheme

comment.narrative: At least 50

0
This will be developed based on biodiversityfriendly tourism legal framework review which will include a set of biodiversity standards developed tested and adopted for the MoTA certification schemes for hotels ecotour operators ecolodges and environmental camp sites Based on this review a certification schemes for Hotel ecotour ecolodge and environmental camp sites will be developed tested and adopted by MoTA according to the new schemes this indicator will be measured Furthermore The project has also succeeded in creating what so called Green unit within MoTA for the first time Green unit will be a key player in mainstreaming biodiversity and environmental issues within MoTA and will effectively contributed to enhance the environmental culture within MoTA employees and among decision makers the project managed the discussion with MoTA and tourism private sector and other relevant stakeholders to approve the establishment of the Green Unit
At least 50

0
This will be developed based on biodiversityfriendly tourism legal framework review which will include a set of biodiversity standards developed tested and adopted for the MoTA certification schemes for hotels ecotour operators ecolodges and environmental camp sites Based on this review a certification schemes for Hotel ecotour ecolodge and environmental camp sites will be developed tested and adopted by MoTA according to the new schemes this indicator will be measured Furthermore The project has also succeeded in creating what so called Green unit within MoTA for the first time Green unit will be a key player in mainstreaming biodiversity and environmental issues within MoTA and will effectively contributed to enhance the environmental culture within MoTA employees and among decision makers the project managed the discussion with MoTA and tourism private sector and other relevant stakeholders to approve the establishment of the Green Unit

description.narrative: The place of biodiversity in the legal and procedural framework for tourism planning development and operations

comment.narrative: Biodiversity considerations are currently absent from the framework
Biodiversity elements are integratedincorporated in the legal and procedural framework for tourism planning development and operations

The project continued its effort to assist MoTA in the process of revising the legal and institutional frameworks by conducting a comprehensive and critical review of the existing legal and institutional set ups the assessment revealed that currently there is poor reference to issue of protecting the natural heritage and biodiversity in the tourism related legal framework under the Ministry of Tourism and Antiquities Most of the provisions of laws and regulations only enforce protection to archeological sites and lack for natural heritage aspect There is a genuine opportunity to modify the legal framework of the tourism sector embarking on the recently reactivated council so called the Higher Tourism Council based on Article 5 under the tourism law the council that includes a representation of the MoEnv is responsible for setting the general policy of the sector and its strategies as well as setting modifications for the regulations The project will continue working with the council to mainstream biodiversity friendly tools and instruments
A green unit has been recently established to serve as a policy tool to mainstream green practices particularly in relation to biodiversity concentration
Biodiversity elements are integratedincorporated in the legal and procedural framework for tourism planning development and operations

The project continued its effort to assist MoTA in the process of revising the legal and institutional frameworks by conducting a comprehensive and critical review of the existing legal and institutional set ups the assessment revealed that currently there is poor reference to issue of protecting the natural heritage and biodiversity in the tourism related legal framework under the Ministry of Tourism and Antiquities Most of the provisions of laws and regulations only enforce protection to archeological sites and lack for natural heritage aspect There is a genuine opportunity to modify the legal framework of the tourism sector embarking on the recently reactivated council so called the Higher Tourism Council based on Article 5 under the tourism law the council that includes a representation of the MoEnv is responsible for setting the general policy of the sector and its strategies as well as setting modifications for the regulations The project will continue working with the council to mainstream biodiversity friendly tools and instruments
A green unit has been recently established to serve as a policy tool to mainstream green practices particularly in relation to biodiversity concentration

description.narrative: - Consideration of biodiversity in plans and policies for tourism development by government, planning authorities and the private sector - Level of consideration for biodiversity conservation in tourism development proposals - Hectares of landscape where impacts on biodiversity are avoided, mitigated or offset --Total annual revenue earned from tourism operations in targeted PAs

comment.narrative: - No explicit reflection of biodiversity priorities - While energy and water feature in environmental considerations at present, biodiversity does not - No planning provisions for the protection of biodiversity outside formal PAs - Annual revenue: Dibeen Forest Reserve: US$ 43,000, Wadi Rum PA: US$ 976,467

- - A biodiversity-friendly tourism charter including a set of standards developed tested and adopted for the MoTA certification schemes for hotels, eco-tour operators, eco-lodges and environmental camp sites. - Biodiversity guidelines for the EIA Process as it applies to tourism developments and operations with particular focus on off-site and cumulative impacts. - Economic incentives and disincentives to promote adherence by tourism industry to the reformed policies and regulation. - Comprehensive land-use plans based on BIMS and covering Jerash Governorate, PDTRA territory, the Petra proposed PA and its buffer zone, and the Greater Wadi Rum Landscapes/Development Zones to set development limits so as to protect biodiversity. - Biodiversity Monitoring System to update and maintain the BIMS, identify trends and ensure that any changes in biodiversity-important areas remain within acceptable limits; to include remedial measures that will be triggered by the monitoring. Include the use of indicator species as appropriate. - Effective interpretation and information facilities at vantage points to inform visitors about the values and vulnerabilities of ecological resources and the consequences (ecological and legal) of not adhering to limits and regulations. - PA Management Advisory Boards for promoting increased involvement of the private sector and local community in PA management. - Dibeen PA, Petra PA and Wadi Rum PA Management Plans revised to reflect the principles espoused in the new Land Use plans and the benefits from new BIMS and Monitoring System. - Visitor management capabilities (to reduce impact on biodiversity) in Dibeen, Petra and Wadi Rum PAs, enhanced through improved visitor facilities, better trained rangers and eco-guides, and improved management capacities, to expand visitor attractions and improve visitor experience while reducing impact on biodiversity in sensitive areas. - Business plans for Dibeen and Petra PAs
Feasibility studies were undertook to developing a small - medium size enterprise within the project sites. Business management capacities were improved for Dibbin, Petra and Wadi Rum PAs
To properly close the project financially
the project was closed financially
To properly close the project operationally
the project was closed operationally
